poem:
The Well-Tempered Key  

In a world turning, Bach's notes  
whisper through Mahan's fingers,  
a script of time unwound.  
Fugue follows prelude,  
an architecture of starlit echoes.  
Each key a prayer, each pause a breath—  
harpsichord strings taut with memory,  
binding centuries in sound,  
a clarity of soul laid bare,  
speaking our shared solitude.
